titlestmt.titleproper: Asian Cultural Council records, Hong Kong Arts Program, Record Group 6
A Guide to the Asian Cultural Council records, Hong Kong Arts Program, Record Group 6 FA1436

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-29 01:20:53 -0400.

did.unittitle: Asian Cultural Council records, Hong Kong Arts Program, Record Group 6

physdesc.extent: 31 letter-size document boxes, 1 half-letter document box, and 1 legal-size document box.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Asian Cultural Council Hong Kong Arts Program files are arranged in three series as follows:
Within series, all records remain in original order.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Other available finding aids describing the Asian Cultural Council records include:

p.extref: FA427 Asian Cultural Council records, Administrative Files, RG 1
FA1400 Asian Cultural Council records, Conferences, Festivals and Seminars RG 2
FA1401 Asian Cultural Council records, Indo-US Subcommission on Education and Culture, RG 3
FA1402 Asian Cultural Council records, Fellowships and Training Programs, RG 4
FA1403 Asian Cultural Council records, Grants, RG 5

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Asian Cultural Council records were donated to the RAC in 2010. The Hong Kong Arts Program files were transferred to RAC in 2015, as accession 2015:091.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Advanced processing, 2015-2018. Records are arranged, described, and rehoused in acid-free containers for long-term preservation. Still images including photographic prints, slides and negatives are housed in mylar sleeves for stabilization.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Asian Cultural Council is a publicly supported not for profit 501(c)(3) established in 1980 to support cultural exchange between Asia and the United States. The Council carries forward the mission of the Asian Cultural Program of the JDR 3rd Fund, which had been created by JDR 3rd in 1963 and was officially dissolved in July 1979.

The Asian Cultural Council maintains offices in New York, Hong Kong, Manila (Philippines), Taipei (Taiwan) and Tokyo. ACC affiliation with the Rockefeller Brothers Fund began in 1991, enabling the Council to reduce administrative overhead and devote a larger percentage of its funds directly to grants and program development.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs, program booklets, publicity materials and videos documenting the events, programs, awards, and grantees of the Hong Kong Arts Program from 1986 through 2014.
